member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.CreateFontFace
member.summary: Creates a font face for a single item (rather than going through the font face reference).
member.param: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.
The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font face object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.CreateFontResource
member.summary: Creates the font resource of a single item.
member.param: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.
The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font resource object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFilteredFontIndices
member.summary: Retrieves all the item indices, filtered by the given ranges.
member.param: List of axis value ranges to filter by.
The number of axis value ranges to filter.
true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any range; false if it should select the intersection of them all.
An ascending array of indices, in the range 0 to minus 1.
The number of indices.
The actual number of indices written or needed, in the range 0 to minus 1.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualIndexCount set to the needed size. The actualIndexCount will always be <= .|

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFilteredFontIndices
member.summary: Retrieves all the item indices, filtered by the given properties.
member.param: List of properties to filter by.
The number of properties to filter.
true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any property; false if it should select the intersection of them all.
An ascending array of indices, in the range 0 to minus 1.
The number of indices.
The actual number of indices written or needed, in the range 0 to minus 1.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualIndexCount set to the needed size. The actualIndexCount will always be <= .|

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFilteredFonts
member.summary: Retrieves a subset of fonts filtered by the given ranges, endpoint-inclusive.
member.param: List of axis value ranges to filter by.
The number of axis value ranges to filter.
true if GetFilteredFonts should select any range; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts that fall within the ranges, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFilteredFonts
member.summary: Retrieves a subset of fonts filtered by the given properties.
member.param: List of properties to filter by.
The number of properties to filter.
true if GetFilteredFontIndices should select any property; false if it should select the intersection of them all.

The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts that match the properties, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFilteredFonts
member.summary: Retrieves a subset of fonts, filtered by the given indices.
member.param: An array of indices to filter by, in the range 0 to minus 1.
The number of indices.

The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to an object representing the subset of fonts indicated by the given indices, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFirstFontResources
member.summary: Retrieves a new font set that contains only the first occurrence of each font resource from the set.
member.param: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a new font set object consisting of single default instances from font resources, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFontAxisRanges
member.summary: Retrieves the axis ranges of a single item.
member.param: Zero-based index of the font in the set.
List of axis value ranges to retrieve.
The number of axis value ranges to retrieve.
The actual number of axis ranges written or needed.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualFontAxisRangeCount set to the needed size.|

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFontAxisRanges
member.summary: Retrieves all axis ranges in the font set; the union of all contained items.
member.param: List of axis value ranges to retrieve.
The number of axis value ranges to retrieve.
The actual number of axis ranges written or needed.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_NOT_SUFFICIENT_BUFFER|The buffer is too small, with actualFontAxisRangeCount set to the needed size.|

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFontFaceReference
member.summary: Retrieves the font face reference of a single item.
member.param: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.
The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to the font face reference.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetFontLocality
member.summary: Retrieves the locality of a single item.
member.param: Zero-based index of the font item in the set.

member.name: IDWriteFontSet1.GetMatchingFonts
member.summary: Retrieves a matching font set based on the requested inputs, ordered so that nearer matches are earlier.
member.param: Font property of interest, such as typographic family or weight/stretch/style family.
A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.
The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.
The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a prioritized list of fonts that match the properties, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
